oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Jackson’s welcome to Philadelphia broadside, circa 1819
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letterpress broadside with an illustration of a horse and rider and a poem. The rider is a man wearing an early 19th century military uniform. The headline reads: General Jackson’s Welcome to Philadelphia. Hail to the Farmer of Great Tennessee Who strengthened the roots of our Liberty tree. The poem that follows praises Andrew Jackson as a general and military leader, proclaiming him the “Hero of New Orleans.” Forms part of the Biography Ephemera Subject Files. 1 broadside; b&w; 7 x 14 in.

Andrew Jackson became a nationwide military hero for his defeat of the British at the Battle of New Orleans during the War of 1812. Jackson visited Philadelphia in February 1819, and it is believed this item was created at that time. The broadside is unattributed, and it is not known for what specific occasion it may have been created.
